name: Salish Lodge & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have long awaited the opportunity to stay at Salish for the
reviews.title: Fine Dining, Great View, Friendly staff

likes.liked: — Dining, wine, view and friendly staff
likes.disliked: — Cleanliness factor - dirty carpets, dirty lavender pillows and it is over priced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: relaxing spa treatments, world class dining, wine list and fantastic views.
reviews.title: Worst hotel experience ever!

likes.disliked: — Rooms, management, price, staff, disappointing location.

reviews.text: However, we found the lodge starting to show its age and in need of some upgrading and deep cleaning. The carpet in our room was so dirty our slippers and socks turned black almost immediately. Cleanliness is a huge factor to us so this was disappointing.
reviews.title: I only wish I could have stayed longer...

likes.disliked: — Check-in was very late in the day

reviews.text: Other than the cleanliness factor, our room was quiet, comfortable and provided a great view of the falls. The fire was laid so all we needed to do was light the match, NICE TOUCH.
reviews.title: Good and Bad

reviews.text: The bathroom amenities were very nice, tub, toiletries, etc. and it was very clean.
reviews.title: Very comfortable, but overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I booked a one night stay with spa treatments and dinner. The dinner was excellent, but I can't say the same for the rest of the experience.
reviews.title: Does not live up to the hype
Beautiful place... Outrageous prices
reviews.text: The spa experience was nothing to brag about. You have to go through the gift shop to get to the sauna area, which I thought was tacky. The locker rooms definitely are not a reflection of the luxurious hotel. They provided one travel hair dryer outside of the locker rooms in a closet-type area. Though the massage was relaxing, the thin doors of the treatment rooms made it possible to hear all of the foot traffic during the massage. In addition, the massage beds were cold and hard.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our dinner in the main dining room was beyond compare! Everything was delicious! The cost of the dinner was beyond compare as well, but we thought it was worth it for the meal, the excellent service, and the wonderful view we had of the falls.
reviews.title: Total comfort at the Salish Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was nice. The bed was very comfortable and we were really looking forward to relaxing in bed and watching a movie after dinner. This was not to be as the t.v. was not working properly. The screen was so dark that we couldn't see the picture. We were forced to wake up at 8 AM due to the hammering that was taking place as they fixed the roof! So much for relaxing in that very comfortable bed.
reviews.title: Nice place...not a nice price

reviews.text: We mentioned the t.v. to the front desk upon check out. They told us that this was not the first time they heard about the problem with the t.v. in this room. When I mentioned the hammering, they did give us a certificate for a massage, but I am not sure that I would go back to redeem it.
reviews.title: Average hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My hubby and I loved Salish Lodge! We stayed there for one night shortly after Christmas. Nothing is better than a long day of skiing at Snoqualmie Summit and later cozing up next to a roaring fire in one of Salish's exquisite rooms. If you really want to feel pampered this is the place to be. My husband relished the enjoyment of our room's mood dimming lights, jet bathtub, big TV, complimentary pillows, soft bathrobes, comfy king-size bed, and breakfast in bed! The service was impeccable. For instance, whenever we asked for complimentary pillows and extra firewood, someone would be knocking at our door within a matter of minutes with our request. The only disadvantage was the price. Yes it broke the bank, but the hubby and I enjoyed being indulgent for one night.
reviews.title: Loved the fireplace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Salish for a long weekend. A perfect amount of time to spend there. The room was perfect with a real wood burning fireplace, a great view, and great room service!
reviews.title: Worth the trip

likes.disliked: — Nothing else to do in the area - but that was a positive too!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa was nice, we spent an entire day there. Book ahead. The staff was overly acoomodating and went out of their way to make sure nothing was missing.
reviews.title: Great time - excellent service
Attic Bistro was terrible...Otherwise a very nice place
reviews.text: The main restaurant was great. We splurged on the course meal jam packed with meals only found in the Pacific Northwest. Make sure to get a window table. We were lucky to be there with a bright moon that lit up the view for the evening. A great dinner.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Take the time to walk down the trail to see the waterfall...and keep going, all the way to the rocky bottom...it's worth the extra effort to see the falls from directly across the small pool of water that it cascades in to.
reviews.title: Stay the night just don’t eat breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This property is expensive for what you get. They do need a remodel ... $400+ for one night with a view of the falls... tv did not really work that well and had bad reception and was very old model from 1980s!? Carpet and chairs need updates...
reviews.title: Charming and a Splurge for a special anniversary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: BUT to the good news....fireplace is amazing and they give you real wood to burn. Jacuzzi bathtub is wonderful for couples. Customer service was great. Comfortable bed and great spa services. Bar was nice, but not a "night scene."
reviews.title: Salish Lodge way overpriced, mediocre service
Lovely
reviews.text: We would stay there again, but only for special anniversaries and such. It's great for a splurge when you want to get out of Seattle... and nice hiking around the area. My advisce is to wait until they have off-peak special discounts on rooms. You can get on their mailing list and they'll let you know when it's only $150 per night to stay there. That way you leave with a little more money in your pocket and still have a charming time. :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently scheduled a weekend at the Salish Lodge, complete with spa treatments and meals. This was not an inexpensive venture, as our final bill for one night's stay with a massage apiece, dinner and breakfast came to just under $1,000. We had made reservations in advance for our massages, but when we checked in and were given our itinerary, the times had changed and, while apologetic, the staff was unable to do anything about it. Instead of having both appointments at the same time, they were booked several hours apart. I took the later appointment and barely had enough time after the massage to prepare for our dinner reservations.
reviews.title: great hotel experience

likes.disliked: — that I didn't have time to check out the spa services

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were seated immediately for dinner, but were seated about as far from the central dining area as could be, in a large room with only one other couple in it. There was no music, so we could hear their entire conversation and I'm sure they could hear ours. The meal was good but not superb as we expected, especially since the entrees each were $52. We ordered a bottle of overpriced wine, but it wasn't brought to the table until we were half way through our entrees. And then we were informed that the bottle we requested was not available but they had another "comparable" in price. Translate that to mean it was more expensive.
reviews.title: Overrated

description: It's hard to imagine a more beautiful setting than Snoqualmie Falls in Washington State. Or a more iconic and distinctive getaway than the Salish Lodge & Spa. Each one of our 84 newly renovated rooms is a luxury mountain retreat of its own, welcoming you with Northwest custom furniture and deluxe finishings. All have oversized jetted tubs and fireplaces, and many have views of the Snoqualmie River. It's the perfect place to relax after spending the day skiing the slopes or hiking the local trails. At the Salish, we have all the luxurious amenities you'd ever want (like choosing from six different types of pillows) but none of the pretentiousness you don't. Come pamper yourself in The Spa, and indulge in our specialized Northwest treatments. And don't forget our hotel's two restaurants - The Dining Room and The Attic - which serve innovative, flavorful food that draws from indigenous ingredients and traditional techniques.
